fields.description: I noticed this when testing prior to the demo yesterday. I have some changes I made in a branch (named for this ticket), but I didn't have time to find out why this isn't working, yet it worked a month ago.
fields.summary: Console doesn't show resources for new eucalyptus region after switching

comments.body:
I found a problem in this commit, which I've commented on and fixing that seems to help. Will do a bunch more testing:
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/commit/8cf0d34ab285773b807bbf4dbcd065b3e08a4149?diff=split

I fixed the problem that commit created. I still see a problem where the very first login to the federated cloud doesn't show a valid default region in the drop-down menu. It's only a visual problem because the 1st region is actually selected. It works fine after the user selects a region, but it's misleading to the user initially.
Tracking it down, I find it occurs when the default.region is not configured in the console.ini. The browser code sees the region in local storage as "undefined", rather than a sensible default.
[~tvo], I want to be sure federation is handled well in the console docs. There is a "default.region" setting in the console.ini which has been added.
[~dkavanagh]: Thanks David. I will create a doc ticket so I don't forget to follow-up on this item.

[~dkavanagh]: Testing on shared setup #1 (in Safari 9.1 on OS 10.10.5) I'm observing the following issues:

1. The region drop-down at top doesn't show the current region.  Configuring 'default.region = region-one' in console.ini doesn't help.
2. The console kicks me out with a "No response from host" message when selecting region-one or region-two from the drop-down.

Screenshots attached

[~dkavanagh]: UPDATE: adding default.region = region-one to console.ini does display that region in the region selector at top (my console failed to restart from some reason when I made that change earlier).  However, I'm still observing the "No response from host" message when switching regions.
[~kgill], can you test with eucalyptus-ui/admin/foobar since your account may not have been created after the federation was fixed? Your symptoms act like the account isn't federated

[~dkavanagh]: Just a heads up that the check_iam_perms() method in views.login.PermissionCheckMixin hard-codes the region to 'euca', and that's where the "No response from host" seems to surface when I tested the GUI-2578 branch on shared setup #1.  Wondering if we need to update that to handle federated clouds?
That is interesting since I didn't get an error there. I updated the code to pull from the session region value.

[~ashamblin], I pointed out in a previous comment,  eucalyptus-ui/admin/foobar may need to be used on this cloud to ensure a valid federated account on the shared setup 1. I don't know if other accounts were created after the cloud was properly federated or not.

OK, I looked at the hastebin and it's showing code that is wrong, maybe old?
That line in auth.py should look like:
            endpoint = [reg.endpoint for reg in regions if reg.name == region]
The PR shows this correct code, so maybe pull again? https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1945/files

I should also check, are both of you upgraded to pycryptopp now? (pip show pycryptopp)

I have a newly installed console running here: http://10.111.30.156:8888/ and it's running this branch. I'm convinced it works properly. We do need to sort out what's causing problems on people's laptops. Not sure if that process should hold up a merge to master though. That may actually force the issue of debug (but in a bad way).

Capturing some notes here from an IRC troubleshooting discussion...

Resolving ufshost names with 'autoqa' started failing for me some time this week.  [~ccassler] suggested adding 10.1.1.254 to the DNS/nameserver, which solved the problem after configuring that in OS X system preferences (Network > Advanced > DNS).  I already had that nameserver in my VPN client config, which seemed adequate until this week.  At any rate, after using the proper ufshost for shared setup 1 (ufshost = g-05-03.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com), the changes in PR 1945 look good to me.
